summary: A Federal Bureau of Prisons memorandum from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, dated August 10, 2019, reporting a failure of the NICEVision camera system on August 8, 2019, which prevented the recovery of video footage from the housing units, including Unit 5-South. The technician stated the system would be fixed on August 9, 2019.

persons.name: Lieutenant
persons.context: The author of the memorandum who discovered the camera system failure while reviewing footage from Unit 5-South.

persons.name: Captain
persons.context: The intended recipient of the memorandum regarding the camera system failure.

persons.name: Communication Technician
persons.role: Technician responding to the camera system issue
persons.context: Responded via radio, confirmed the cameras were not recording and could not retrieve video, and stated he would fix the system on August 9, 2019.

connections.description: Lieutenant is reporting an incident to the Captain via an official memorandum.
Lieutenant contacted the Communication Technician via radio to report and investigate the camera system failure.

events.title: NICE Camera System Failure Discovered
events.description: At approximately 3:45 PM, while reviewing the NICE Camera System, the Lieutenant discovered an inability to recover video footage from Unit 5-South and subsequently found none of the cameras on the system were recording.

events.title: Scheduled Camera System Repair
events.description: The Communication Technician stated he would fix the camera system on Friday, August 9, 2019, when he arrived to work.

locations: MCC New York, 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: On August 8, 2019, the NICEVision camera system at the MCC New York failed, preventing the recovery of any video footage.
The failure was discovered while reviewing footage specifically from Unit 5-South, a housing unit.
A Communication Technician confirmed the system was not recording and there was no way to retrieve any video.
The technician scheduled the repair for the next day, August 9, 2019.
The document is a formal government memorandum dated August 10, 2019, reporting this technical failure.
